questions.text: Which of the following statements is true for type 1 diabetes?

options.label: C
options.text: It is not associated with thyroid disorders

options.label: D
options.text: Insulin resistance is the hallmark of the disease pathogenesis

questions.correct_answer: A. It is an autoimmune disease

questions.text: In diabetes all of the following statement are correct EXCEPT

options.label: A
options.text: Recognised endocrine causes of diabetes include acromegaly and cushing’s syndrome

options.label: B
options.text: The majority of type 2 diabetes mellitus patients die from cardiovascular disease

options.label: C
options.text: Fasting blood sugar more than 126 establishes diagnosis of diabetes

options.label: D
options.text: Patients with type 2 diabetes are more prone to ketoacidosis as compared to type 1

questions.correct_answer: D. Patients with type 2 diabetes are more prone to ketoacidosis as compared to type 1

questions.text: A 52 year old female patient is suffering from type 2 diabetes mellitus and hypertension. Which of the following antihypertensive drug should not be used in such patients?
Which of the following is not a test for diabetes mellitus?
Which of the following findings can establish a diagnosis of diabetes mellitus?

options.label: A
options.text: Fasting plasma glucose > 100 mg/dl and 2 hour post-prandial more than 140 mg/dl

options.label: B
options.text: Fasting plasma glucose > 125 mg/dl and 2 hour post-prandial more than 199 mg/dl

options.label: C
options.text: Symptoms of diabetes plus random blood glucose of 190 mg/dl

questions.text: Impaired glucose tolerance on an oral GTT is indicated by

options.label: C
options.text: Fasting blood sugar < 140 mg/dl and 2 hours after glucose load < 200 mg/dl

options.label: D
options.text: 2 hours after glucose load 140-199 mg/dl, fasting blood sugar < 125 mg/dl

questions.correct_answer: D. 2 hours after glucose load 140-199 mg/dl, fasting blood sugar < 125 mg/dl

questions.text: All are seen in DKA except
Increased anion gap in DKA is due to

options.label: A
options.text: Loss of H + ions in urine

options.label: B
options.text: Loss of HCO 3 - ions in urine

options.label: C
options.text: Excess of H+ ions combines with HCO 3 -

options.label: D
options.text: Loss of Cl - ions in urine

questions.correct_answer: C. Excess of H+ ions combines with HCO 3 -

questions.text: A 36 year old male who is a known case of type 1 diabetes brought to casualty in semicomatose state and with history of fever since last 1 week. Blood tests showed glucose- 400 mg/dl, potassium- 5.8 meq/lit, serum osmolality- 310 mOsm/lit, plasma ketones +++, arterial pH- 6.8. What is the most probable diagnosis?

A 59 year old male who is a known case of type 2 diabetes brought to casualty in semicomatose state and with history of fever since last 1 week. Blood tests showed glucose- 800 mg/dl, potassium- 4.6 meq/lit, serum osmolality- 350 mOsm/lit, plasma ketones -, arterial pH- 6.8. What is the most probable diagnosis?
The drug of choice in a 50 year old patient presenting with hyperglycemia and ketoacidosis is?

options.label: C
options.text: Oral drugs with intermediate acting insulin

questions.text: All of the following statements about diabetic ketoacidosis are true EXCEPT:

options.label: D
options.text: Serum bicarbonate in DKA is > 15 meq/L

questions.correct_answer: D. Serum bicarbonate in DKA is > 15 meq/L

questions.text: If a patient with severe hyperglycemia is given iv insulin, which of the following can occur?
Which of the following statements about dawn phenomenon is true?

options.label: D
options.text: Morning hypoglycaemia due to excess insulin

questions.correct_answer: C. Morning hyperglycemia with midnight hyperglycemia

questions.text: The characteristic and common presentation of diabetic neuropathy is:
The most characteristic finding in diabetic nephropathy is:

A patient presents with symptoms of hypoglycaemia investigations reveal decreased blood glucose and increased insulin levels. C-peptide assay is done which shows normal level of C-peptide. The most likely diagnosis is
Which type of diabetes is HLA associated:
A 50 year old male with type 2 diabetes mellitus is found to have 24-hour urinary albumin of 250 mg. Which of the following drugs may be used to retard progression of renal disease?

Consider the following features: 1. Severe dehydration 2. Blood sugar above 750mg% 3. Ketonuria 4. Serum sodium less than 120 mEq/L Which of these features are characteristic of hyperosmolar hyperglycemic state?
Most common cause of primary hyperparathyroidism is
Which of the following is associated with secondary hyperparathyroidism due to dietary deficiency of calcium?
Increased calcium with decreased phosphate levels are seen in ?

options.label: B
options.text: Secondary hyperparathyroidism due to vitamin D deficiency

questions.text: A 40 year old man known case of chronic renal failure develops rugger jersey spine. The probable cause is-
In hyperparathyroidism all are seen in except
Primary hyperparathyroidism is suggested by all of the following except
Low calcium and high phosphate is seen in-
Which of the following is not a feature of hypercalcemia

A 75 year old lady with fracture neck of femur presents with two days history altered sensorium and decreased urinary output. Serum calcium is 15.5 mg/dl, urea is 140 mg/dl, creatinine is 2 mg/dl. All of the following are useful for immediate , management of hypercalcemia, Except;
Hypercalcemia associated with malignancy is most often mediated by
All of the following are seen in tumor lysis syndrome except?
Which of the following conditions is associated with hypothyroidism?
Which of the following is not associated with primary hypothyroidism?
The most common cause of hyperthyroidism is
All of the following are features of hypothyroidism except
All of the following are features of thyrotoxicosis except
The best marker to diagnose thyroid related disorder is?
Lab investigation of patient shows lowT3, lowT4, lowTSH. It suggests-
The occurrence of hyperthyroidism following administration of supplemental iodine to subjects with endemic iodine deficiency goiter is known as-
Decreased iodine uptake is seen in
Life threatening exacerbation of hyperthyroidism accompanied by fever, delirium, coma, vomiting, diarrhoea, jaundice is called as-
How is hypothyroidism treated?
Hypothyroidism treatment is best monitored by?
A 34 year old man reports to your office complaining of weight loss and sweating. Among other findings you note the following, while examining his extraocular movements: What do we call this finding?

A 35 year old woman, who was 2 months pregnant, was found to have FT4 of 3.3 ng/dL (normal 0.9-2) and TSH < 0.01 IU/mL (normal 0.5-4.7) during a follow up visit. Which of the following drug treatment would be most appropriate for this patient?

A 75-year-old woman came to the clinic for her regular checkup. Her only complaints included very dry skin and constipation which she treats with milk of magnesia. She had no other medical problems and took no other medications. Routine laboratory tests are within normal limits except for a TSH of 15 mIU/mL (normal 0.5-5.5). Further lab exams indicated the presence of thyroid peroxidase antibodies. Which of the following drug would be appropriate for this patient?
A 30 year old woman presented with secondary amennorhea for 3 years along with galactorrhea.The most likely her symptoms would be due to:
Pituitary macroadenoma refers to size of tumour –
When PRL level is >200 mcg/L the most common cause is ?
Macroprolactenemia refers to :-

options.label: C
options.text: Pitutarytumor>4 cm with elevated PRL levels

options.label: D
options.text: Any size pituitary adenoma with PRL > 1000 mcg/L .

questions.correct_answer: B. A large polymeric prolactin molecule

questions.text: A 20 year old woman on risperidone for BPAD presents with amenorrhea and galactorrhea and is found to have an elevated Prolactin(PRL) level 80 mcg/L .What is next best step in her management?

options.label: C
options.text: Stop Risperidone and measure PRL after 3 days.

options.label: D
options.text: Switch to an atypical antipsychotic in consultation with her psychiatrist.

questions.correct_answer: C. Stop Risperidone and measure PRL after 3 days.

questions.text: A young women with secondary amenorrhoea ,galactorrhea and bitemporal heminopia .MRI shows a tumor of 25mm diameter in pituitary fossa.Treatment is;
True about Prolactinoma in pregnancy are all except:

options.label: A
options.text: Most common tumors in pregnancy and are usually asymptomatic

options.label: B
options.text: The size of the tumor increases in pregnancy

options.label: C
options.text: Increasing prolactin levels indicates bad prognosis/requires monitoring

options.label: D
options.text: In macroadenomas of 1cm may lead to optic chiasma compression

questions.correct_answer: C. Increasing prolactin levels indicates bad prognosis/requires monitoring

questions.text: 8 months pregnant female with past history of prolactinoma presents with headache and no visual impairement .Which of the following is the most appropriate immediate step in her management :-
Which of the following is not a presenting feature of hyperprolactinemia in women ?
Which of the following is false about prolactin ?

options.label: A
options.text: Peak serum PRL levels occur between 4-6 A.M

options.label: B
options.text: Circulating half life of PRL is 50 minutes.

options.label: C
options.text: Predominant central control mechanism is inhibitory.

questions.text: Which of the following is not action of IGF-1 :-
Which of the following about serum IGF-1 concentration is false ?

options.label: A
options.text: Levels peak at 16 years of age

options.label: B
options.text: Higher in males than in females.

questions.correct_answer: B. Higher in males than in females.

questions.text: Confirmatory investigation for acromegaly
All are seen in Gigantism except :-
Which of the following is not a clinical feature of Acromegaly
Which of the following regarding acromegaly is false?

options.label: A
options.text: Often clinically not diagnosed for 10 years or more.

options.label: B
options.text: Without treatment survival is reduced by 10 years.

options.label: C
options.text: Hypertension occur in about 75 % of patients

options.label: D
options.text: Diabetes mellitus develops in 25 % of patients

questions.correct_answer: C. Hypertension occur in about 75 % of patients

questions.text: ADH/Vasopressin causes water reabsorption in collecting duct via which aquaporin(AQP ) channels ?
At high concentrations ,AVP action includes ?

options.label: A
options.text: Smooth muscle contraction of blood vessels & GI tract.

questions.text: The average threshold or set point for AVP release corresponds to a plasma sodium about ?
Pitutary bright spot is absent in patients with ?

options.label: C
options.text: Empty sella who do not have DI.

questions.text: Which of the following is not a cause for diabetes insipidus
Which of the following clinical features of diabetes insipidus is false :-

options.label: A
options.text: Daily urine volume is less than 50 mL/kg.

questions.correct_answer: A. Daily urine volume is less than 50 mL/kg.

questions.text: Choose the best Lab value for patient with central diabetes insipidus:

In a 60 old female with polydipsia, ADH obtained are as follows The baseline: Sodium 151 Plasma osmolality 300 Urinary osmolality 150 After Vasopressin: Sodium 142 Potassium 3.9 Plasma osmolality 290 Urinary osmolality 480 These findings suggest a diagnosis of

A patient with polyuria has following values before and after ADH stimulation test Baseline Serum osm-300 Urine osm -150 After ADH Serum osm -300 Urine osm -160. Which of the following is the likely diagnosis ?

A 33 year old lady with polydipsia and polyuria.Her symptoms started soon afer a road traffic accident 6 months ago.The blood pressure is 120/80 mm Hg with no postural drop. The daily urinary output is 6-8 litres.In investigation showed Na-130 meq/l,K-3.5 meq/l,urea-15 mg/dl,sugar-64 mg/dl.The plasma osmolality is 268 msosm/L and urine osmolality 45 osmol/L.The most likely diagnosis is :

A patient following head injury was admitted in intensive care ward with signs of raised intrancranialpressure.He was put on ventilator and started on intravenous fluids and diuretics .24 hrs. Later his urine output was 3.5 Litres,serum Na-156 meq/l and urine osmolarity of 316 mOsm/L.The most likely diagnosis based on these parameters;

options.label: C
options.text: Too mush infusion of normal saline

questions.correct_answer: A. High output due to diuretics

questions.text: A vasopressin analogue does not produce therapeutic effect through vasopressin-2 receptor in which of the following;
All of the following are true about SIADH except –

options.label: A
options.text: Vaptans are approved by FDA for its treatment

options.label: B
options.text: Water-loading test can be used for diagnosis of the condition

options.label: C
options.text: Urine sodium is usually low or normal in these patients

options.label: D
options.text: Serum sodium may be as low as 125 mEq/L in these patients

questions.correct_answer: C. Urine sodium is usually low or normal in these patients

questions.text: The syndrome of SIADH is characterized by the following:-
questions.correct_answer: A. Hyponatremia and urine sodium excretion >20meq/l.
